The story unfolds as a woman observes a seemingly perfect couple from her daily train commute, until something shocking happens. Enjoy the suspense!

Also, if you're open to watching a classic, "Madame Bovary" is an emotional drama about a woman seeking excitement and passion in her mundane life, starring some talented actors. It might resonate with the depth you mentioned earlier.

If you're interested in a more action-packed film, "The Wraith" might be up your alley. It's about a mysterious stranger who takes on a ruthless road-racing gang in a small Arizona town, adding a touch of suspense and thrill to the story. Enjoy!

Given your preference for a different vibe, I'd recommend "Her" (2013). It explores modern dating experiences through an experimental docu-narrative, with Scarlett Johansson providing the voice of an operating system that develops a romantic relationship with its user. This thought-provoking film might offer a fresh perspective on your expectations.

If you're interested in a supernatural twist, "Club Dead" (2003) could also be intriguing. It's about a group of friends who discover that the popular nightspot they've been trying to get into is run by the undead, leading to chaos and a desperate attempt to escape.
